title: Where does trash go?
summary: This book teaches children how trash can change in Timor-Leste, and why it is important to sort and recycle trash to live together with nature.

texts: Patrocino, Joel, Noel, Bernadete, Jenildo, Narlia, Monica Cessy, Berta Pinto, Teodoru, Vidal, Lindalva, Odilton
My family lives in Timor-Leste, a place where many plants grow.
I give water to the plants so they can grow well.
The clovers and trees also drink the water I give and grow.
When the trees grow big, special fruits that only grow in Timor-Leste also appear.
To help the flowers and trees grow well, we need to collect trash properly.
Trash looks dirty. But why do we need to collect it properly?
If we collect trash properly, we can recycle it. For example, it can become a beautiful flower pot.
This trash can also be transformed into special trash bins near the sea.
Therefore, we need to collect trash properly to live together with nature.
This is a rule everyone must follow to live together with people and nature! Please throw trash in the correct place.

missions.title: Observe Trash
missions.description: Observe trash around you. Separate trash that can be recycled from trash that cannot. Write or draw your observations.

vocabulary.definition: Objects that are no longer used and will be thrown away.
Using old trash to make new objects.
The environment, including plants, trees, and animals, that exists without human creation.
An object made from recycled trash to grow flowers.
A set of laws or guidelines that people must follow.
